metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9964 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
redirect() in bottle.py in bottle 0.12.10 doesn't filter a "\r\n" sequence,which leads to a CRLF attack, as demonstrated by aredirect("233\r\nSet-Cookie: name=salt") call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-bottle - 0.12.11-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-bottle package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.12.11-1').
